author: Joseph Epstein
title: I Loved College Basketball, but Now I Feel March Sadness
text:
As this year’s NCAA basketball tournament proceeds, I shall not be filling in my brackets. Nor shall I be betting a small packet on any of the 68 teams going to the Big Dance, as they call it. Not one has the least interest for me. You might catch me watching a college basketball or football game, but for years my old passion for these sports has been draining away. My interest now, more aesthetic than athletic, is increasingly in the players’ rococo hairdos, body tattoos and exotic first names. 

Despite a lifelong addiction...
